FuncDef:
The snmp-agent udp-port command changes the port number monitored by the SNMP agent.
The undo snmp-agent udp-port command restores the default port number monitored by the SNMP agent. The snmp-agent udp-port command changes the port number monitored by the SNMP agent. The undo snmp-agent udp-port command restores the default port number monitored by the SNMP agent. By default, the port number monitored by the SNMP agent is 161.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the port number.
The value is 161 or an integer ranging from 1025 to 65535.

ExtraInfo:
The SNMP agent is an agent running on network devices. By default, the SNMP agent manages devices by monitoring port 161 on a device and responding to messages sent by the NMS. As the port number monitored is fixed, this brings security risks. For example, all attack packets may be sent to this port, which causes a network congestion.
To improve device security, run the snmp-agent udp-port command to change the port number monitored by the SNMP agent.
